name: GetCustomerPaymentMethods
description:
Retrieve payment methods for a specific customer.

This tool should be called to obtain a list of payment methods associated with a particular customer in Stripe.

parameters.name: customer_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the customer whose payment methods are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: enable_redisplay_setting
parameters.description: Indicates if the payment method can be shown again in a checkout flow. Options: 'always', 'limited', 'unspecified'.

value_schema.description: This field indicates whether this payment method can be shown again to its customer in a checkout flow. Stripe products such as Checkout and Elements use this field to determine whether a payment method can be shown as a saved payment method in a checkout flow.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before_id
parameters.description: An object ID used to paginate backwards by defining the end of the list.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `ending_before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with `obj_bar`, your subsequent call can include `ending_before=obj_bar` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: response_fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields to expand in the response for detailed information.

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: max_payment_methods_returned
parameters.description: Limit the number of payment methods returned. Accepts a value between 1 and 100, with a default of 10.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for pagination that defines the start point in the list. Use the ID of the last object from the previous page.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `starting_after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with `obj_foo`, your subsequent call can include `starting_after=obj_foo` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: payment_method_type_filter
parameters.description: Specify a payment method type to filter the list. Without filtering, all types are included. Choose from options like 'card', 'paypal', etc.

value_schema.description: An optional filter on the list, based on the object `type` field. Without the filter, the list includes all current and future payment method types. If your integration expects only one type of payment method in the response, make sure to provide a type value in the request.
